greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 355 / 113.
comment: This is an approximation to Pi. It is accurate to 0.00000849%.
355/113 is the third convergent of the continued fraction expansion of Pi (A001203). - _Lekraj Beedassy_, Jun 18 2003

In one of Ramanujan's papers, a note at the bottom states that "If the area of the circle be 140,000 square miles, then RD [RD = d/2 * Sqrt(355/113) = r*Sqrt(Pi), very nearly] is greater than the true length by about an inch."
reference: Ramanujan's papers, "Squaring the circle", Journal of the Indian Mathematical Society, V, 1913, 132. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 30 2014
link: Dario Castellanos, The ubiquitous pi, Math. Mag., 61 (1988), 67-98 and 148-163. [_N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 24 2012]
Dale, Fun and interesting facts about Pi
Index entries for sequences related to the number Pi
formula: a(n) = a(n - 112) for n > 113. - _Jeppe Stig Nielsen_, Dec 14 2019
program: (PARI) a(n) = if(n==1, 3, digits(16*10^112 \ 113)[(n-2) % 112 + 1]) \\ _Jeppe Stig Nielsen_, Dec 14 2019
results.author: _Nenad Radakovic_, Mar 22 2002
ext: Terms a(106) and beyond from _Jeppe Stig Nielsen_, Dec 14 2019
